claim: Miami is a city on the American West Coast.

supporting.text: Miami is located in the southeastern part of the United States, specifically in Florida, which is on the East Coast.

attacks.text: Miami is located in the southeastern part of the United States, specifically in Florida, which is on the East Coast.
Florida has a panhandle region that extends westward, making some parts of the state geographically closer to the Gulf Coast than the East Coast.
The panhandle region is a small part of Florida, and Miami is far from it, remaining firmly on the East Coast.
Some definitions of 'West Coast' include the Gulf Coast, which could technically place Miami on a 'western' coast relative to the Atlantic.
The term 'West Coast' in the U.S. is universally understood to refer to the Pacific Coast, not the Gulf Coast.

supporting.text: The American West Coast includes states like California, Oregon, and Washington, none of which include Miami.

attacks.text: The American West Coast includes states like California, Oregon, and Washington, none of which include Miami.
Miami is located in Florida, which is on the East Coast of the United States, not the West Coast.
Florida is geographically part of the Southeastern United States, further confirming Miami's location on the East Coast.

supporting.text: Geographically, Miami is situated on the Atlantic Ocean, which borders the East Coast, not the Pacific Ocean, which borders the West Coast.

attacks.text: Geographically, Miami is situated on the Atlantic Ocean, which borders the East Coast, not the Pacific Ocean, which borders the West Coast.

Some definitions of 'West Coast' include regions beyond the Pacific coastline, such as parts of the Gulf of Mexico, which could ambiguously place Miami on a 'western' coast relative to certain perspectives.
The Gulf of Mexico is not traditionally considered part of the West Coast, and such definitions are not recognized in standard geographic or cartographic conventions.
Miami is culturally and economically linked to Latin America, which some might associate more with 'western' regions of the Americas, even if not geographically on the West Coast.
Cultural and economic ties do not redefine geographic boundaries; Miami remains firmly on the East Coast by all standard geographic measures.

supporting.text: Major cities on the American West Coast include Los Angeles, San Francisco, and Seattle, none of which are Miami.

attacks.text: Major cities on the American West Coast include Los Angeles, San Francisco, and Seattle, none of which are Miami.
Miami is located in Florida, which is on the southeastern coast of the United States, not the West Coast.
Geographical definitions can sometimes be ambiguous, and some might colloquially refer to any coastal city as being on a 'West Coast' if it is on the western side of a landmass.
Florida is universally recognized as part of the East Coast in all official geographical and governmental contexts, leaving no ambiguity.
